This is one of the most important parts of the game progress, the stat points.
Each time you level up, character stats remain the same.
Instead, every time you level up you get 8 stat points so you can
In the menu go to “stats boost” section
Once here there are a couple of things to keep in mind every time
you want to spend your points
Once here there are a couple of things to check out
The first thing you should notice is that next to the upgradeable
stats you will see their cost and the amount of points
The more you improve a statistic, the more points you will be
For example, the HP statistic was repeatedly increased and
Finally, if you have invested your points wrongly, or
simply want to try different things, you can revert the
statistics as many times as you want and your points will
be returned without any problem or cost!
So don't be afraid to try different things, as keep in mind
that some skills scale better with X stats and others with Y.
I will explain the basics of the skill system, although it is
Skills can be obtained in several ways: leveling up, completing quests,
If you pay attention at the top of the page you have a brief
For example, this skill has some interesting features
The first thing we can see is that it is an instantaneous casting skill [I.C].
This means that every time you use it you will not lose your turn.
After that it tells you that you need a Kunai in your inventory, i.e.
every time you use this skill you will lose a Kunai.
If you don't have any, you won't be able to use the skill.
It is also an ability that has a 30% chance of causing
And lastly, it is a skill that scales with strength (attack),
that is, the more you improve this statistic, the more damage
you will do with this skill.
You may also have noticed that there are two empty spaces in the skills tab.
This means that the maximum number of slots for skills is 6.
Once you advance enough and have more than 6 skills, you can switch between them.
Just select the skill you want to remove and replace it with
another one you are not using.
In this case I have all slots occupied, so I want to remove the Kunai skill
and replace it with this other one
Once I pess on the skill I want to change, the skill is
equipped and ready to be used in combat.
Don't forget to check the “ninja path” option and verify if
you can get any skill through a special mission!
Equipment is another vital part of progress, without equipment you will
have a hard time even at a high level!
So please, pay attention and don't miss this stage.
Equipment is classified as: general, light and heavy.
General: Can be used by any character.
Light and/or heavy only some specific characters
For example, Sakura can only use heavy equipment,
while Rock Lee (CH. NOT IMPLEMENTED) only uses light equipment.
Naruto, on the other hand, is a versatile character who
can use any type of equipment.
If you pay attention to the top you have a description of
the equipment. In this case, the equipment belongs to a set.
For each part you equip, you will get benefits as shown
In this case, if you complete all 5 parts you will get a
special passive that will give you a chance to attack
On the other hand, some of the equipments also have requirements to be able
to be equipped, in this case, which you can check in the
By pressing the right-arrow key you will be able to see it.
In this case the equipment has a requirement that the character to be
equipped must be at least level 19.
Finally, the equipment may vary a little bit in stats each time you craft it,
